title: Alien Zoo Adventure #49
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Observation Deck
rooms.description: A curved viewing gallery with massive reinforced windows overlooking alien habitats. Bioluminescent creatures float in zero-gravity chambers while crystalline beings pulse with inner light. Control panels blink with status indicators. The air smells of ozone and recycled atmosphere. Emergency lighting casts an eerie blue glow across the deck.

items.name: viewing console
items.description: A sleek control station with multiple screens displaying habitat information
items.text: XENOZOOLOGICAL RESEARCH STATION - Established 2247. Director: Dr. Aria Vex. Chief Xenobiologist: Dr. Marcus Kane. Specimen habitats: Nebula creatures in zero-gravity chambers, crystal beings in thermal zones, shadow entities in dark containment.

items.name: information kiosk
items.description: An interactive display terminal for visitors

items.name: visitor guide datapad
items.description: A digital guide to the alien zoo facility
items.text: Welcome to the Xenozoological Research Station! Founded in 2247, we house the galaxy's most fascinating alien lifeforms. Director Dr. Aria Vex oversees all operations. Emergency protocols require staff authorization. Remember: you are a xenobiologist studying these magnificent creatures.

items.name: specimen information display
items.description: A holographic display showing details about the alien creatures
items.text: CURRENT SPECIMENS: Nebula Drifters (zero-gravity chamber), Crystalline Singers (thermal zone), Shadow Wraiths (dark containment), Plasma Jellies (electromagnetic field). All specimens are contained in specialized habitats designed by Dr. Kane.

items.name: emergency storage locker
items.description: A metal locker with three compartments for emergency supplies

items.name: research journal
items.description: A digital journal with scientific observations
items.text: Dr. Kane's Log: The specimens are thriving in their habitats. The zero-gravity chamber houses our nebula creatures perfectly. Director Vex has secured additional funding. The locker combination is the year we opened: 2247. In emergencies, containment control is the safest route to escape pods.

items.name: security access card
items.description: A magnetic card with clearance for restricted areas

items.name: reinforced observation window
items.description: A massive transparent barrier showing the alien habitats beyond
items.text: Through the window, you see the zero-gravity chamber where ethereal nebula creatures drift like living clouds. Their bioluminescence creates a mesmerizing light show.

items.name: containment control door
items.description: A heavy security door leading to the containment control center. A card reader glows beside it.

rooms.name: Containment Control Center
rooms.description: A high-tech command center filled with monitoring stations and holographic displays. Screens show real-time feeds of alien habitats. Warning lights flash amber on several panels. The hum of life support systems fills the air. A sealed emergency door leads to the escape pod bay.

items.name: main control console
items.description: The primary control station for all facility operations
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: All habitats stable. Zero-gravity chamber: Operational. Thermal zone: Optimal. Dark containment: Secure. Emergency evacuation protocols available. Facility Director: Dr. Aria Vex. Authorization required for escape pod access.

items.name: habitat monitoring screens
items.description: Multiple screens displaying live feeds from specimen habitats
items.text: Camera feeds show: Nebula creatures floating peacefully in the zero-gravity chamber. Crystal beings resonating in the thermal zone. Shadow entities contained in dark chambers. All specimens secure and healthy.

items.name: personnel assignment board
items.description: A digital display showing staff assignments and credentials
items.text: STAFF ROSTER: Dr. Aria Vex - Facility Director, All Operations. Dr. Marcus Kane - Chief Xenobiologist, Specimen Care. Dr. Sarah Chen - Habitat Engineer. All xenobiologists have emergency evacuation clearance.

items.name: equipment storage cabinet
items.description: A secure cabinet containing emergency equipment and supplies

items.name: emergency distress beacon
items.description: A portable device for signaling rescue ships

items.name: emergency evacuation guide
items.description: A manual detailing escape procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of containment breach or facility emergency, proceed to escape pod bay. Security verification required. You must confirm: Who directs this facility? Where are nebula specimens housed? What is your role here?

items.name: director's workstation
items.description: Dr. Vex's personal desk with research materials and reports

items.name: director's personal log
items.description: A private journal belonging to Dr. Vex
items.text: Director's Log: As facility director, I'm proud of what we've accomplished. Our xenobiologists do incredible work. The zero-gravity chamber is my favorite - watching the nebula creatures drift is hypnotic. Remember: only authorized xenobiologists can access escape pods in emergencies.

items.name: specimen database terminal
items.description: A computer terminal with detailed records of all alien specimens
items.text: SPECIMEN DATABASE: Nebula Drifters - Location: Zero-Gravity Chamber. Crystalline Singers - Location: Thermal Zone. Shadow Wraiths - Location: Dark Containment. Plasma Jellies - Location: Electromagnetic Field. All specimens catalogued and monitored by xenobiology team.

items.name: emergency escape pod door
items.description: A reinforced door leading to the escape pod bay. A security terminal displays three verification questions in glowing text.

password_questions.question: Who directs this facility?
password_questions.hint: Check the control console and personnel board for the director's name

password_questions.question: Where are nebula specimens housed?
password_questions.hint: Look at the habitat monitors and specimen database

password_questions.question: What is your role?
password_questions.hint: The visitor guide and evacuation manual mention your profession

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Pod Bay
rooms.description: You've reached the escape pod bay! A sleek emergency vessel sits in its launch cradle, systems humming with readiness. Through the transparent launch tube, you can see the stars beyond. The pod's interior glows with soft blue light, and the control panel displays 'READY FOR LAUNCH' in bright green letters. Safety harnesses await inside.

items.name: emergency escape pod
items.description: A streamlined spacecraft designed for rapid evacuation to the nearest space station

items.name: launch control panel
items.description: The pod's control system showing all systems operational and ready
items.text: ESCAPE POD STATUS: All systems green. Life support: Active. Navigation: Locked on nearest station. Propulsion: Ready. Launch sequence: Armed. Welcome aboard, xenobiologist.

items.name: launch tube viewport
items.description: A window showing the launch trajectory into space
items.text: Through the viewport, you see the vast expanse of space. Stars twinkle in the distance, and a space station is visible on the horizon. Freedom awaits.

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You board the escape pod and initiate the launch sequence. The pod accelerates smoothly through the launch tube and into the void of space. Behind you, the alien zoo facility grows smaller as you speed toward the safety of the space station. You've escaped the Xenozoological Research Station and lived to tell the tale of the incredible alien creatures you studied. You win!
